objectives.description: Recognize the essential components of an effective resume and their purpose.
Recognize the importance of personal branding in career development and job searching.
Create strategies for highlighting skills and experiences in a resume format.
Learn how to tailor resumes for different career opportunities and build a personal brand.

terms.definition: Strong, descriptive verbs that demonstrate accomplishments and responsibilities on a resume.

infoCard.title: Key Elements of Your Brand:
items: Value Proposition: What unique combination do you offer?
Target Audience: Who needs to know about you?

layoutData.title: Four Steps to Develop Your Brand
bulletPoints:
1. Self-Assessment
What are your core strengths? What makes you different? What are your professional values?

2. Brand Statement
Create a brief statement capturing your professional identity‚Äîlike an elevator pitch

3. Visual Identity
Professional photo, consistent colors/fonts, clean professional email address

4. Content Strategy
Topics you'll discuss, expertise you'll demonstrate, tone and style

keyPoint.text: üìå Example Brand Statement: "I'm a business analytics student with strong data visualization skills and experience in retail market research. I combine technical expertise with creative problem-solving to help organizations translate data into actionable strategies."

scenario.name: Carlos: Resume Transformation in {{STATE_NAME}}
paragraphs: Carlos was applying for programming internships but wasn't getting interview calls despite having relevant coursework and projects.
Before: Listed coursework without practical applications, used generic descriptions like "Worked on database project," had a vague objective statement.
After: Added specific programming languages and tools, transformed descriptions: "Developed a database application that reduced data retrieval time by 40%", created a targeted professional summary.

scenario.name: Maya: Building a Personal Brand in {{STATE_NAME}}
paragraphs: Maya wanted to establish herself in graphic design but was competing with many other design graduates.
Brand Positioning: Identified her niche as "sustainable design specialist who transforms complex information into clear visual narratives."
Cohesive Identity: Developed a personal logo, used consistent green/blue color palette across resume, portfolio, and social media. Even used recycled materials for printed portfolio.
Content Strategy: Shared case studies emphasizing environmental impact, posted design tips on sustainable practices.
